issue.title: Make `st.selectbox` dropdown scroll along with option in focus, when navigating with arrow keys (‚Üë‚Üì)

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Problem

When navigating the options of a `st.selectbox` widget using the arrow keys (‚Üë‚Üì), the dropdown does not scroll up/down along with the option in focus.

This is only noticeable when there are 9 or more options to select from.

### Solution

**Preferred solution:** Dropdown scrolls up/down along with option in focus, when navigating with arrow keys (‚Üë‚Üì)

### Additional context

From the user's perspective, if you don't see what option is in focus, you don't know when to stop scrolling (in this scenario, hitting up/down arrow keys).

---

Community voting on feature requests enables the Streamlit team to understand which features are most important to our users.

**If you'd like the Streamlit team to prioritize this feature request, please use the üëç (thumbs up emoji) reaction in response to the initial post.**

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-4671)

body:
Hey @marduk2,

thanks for the idea! This seems reasonable, I'll add it to our roadmap. It's not super high priority in my eyes though, so I'd expect this to take a bit longer to fix.

Hey there @jrieke,

Thanks for replying and tagging this properly, appreciate it! Our users will be very happy if this improvement gets made :)

Also consider the other yet related issue which I already added a couple of months ago: [#4671](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/4671) (mentioning it in case it makes sense to tackle both at the same time when you get to them).

issue.title: Impossible to highlight the selection text in `st.selectbox` to delete it all at once

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Summary

- When using the `st.selectbox`, you cannot highlight the text of the current selection and delete it at once (e.g., using backspace key).
- Sometimes it lets you highlight the selection text, but only when `st.selectbox` is not in focus (so backspace key doesn't do anything).
- This means users are only able to delete any selection letter by letter.

### Steps to reproduce

[![Open in Streamlit Cloud](https://static.streamlit.io/badges/streamlit_badge_black_white.svg)](https://issues.streamlitapp.com/?issue=gh-5240)

Code snippet:

```
import streamlit as st
st.selectbox('Example options',options = ('option 1','option 2','option 3'))
```

**Expected behavior:**

The current selection text in `st.selectbox` can be highlighted while in focus (and e.g., deleted at once using backspace key). 

### Is this a regression?

No

### Additional information

This is one of several UX issues detected for `st.selectbox`. Others are:

- #4671 
- #4901 

---

Community voting on feature requests enables the Streamlit team to understand which features are most important to our users.

**If you'd like the Streamlit team to prioritize this feature request, please use the üëç (thumbs up emoji) reaction in response to the initial post.**

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-5240)

issue.title: Add parameter to enable/disable text search in `st.selectbox`

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Problem

`st.selectbox` is one of the most widely used Streamlit widgets, as it allows the user to select one option from a list of options. 

The current implementation allows **text searching**, which for some use cases makes sense (e.g., a long list of countries), but for others it makes the widget feel buggy (e.g., a selectbox with very few options, such as "Yes, No").

### Solution

**MVP:** An example on how to use the CSS st.markdown trick to disable text search in `st.selectbox`.

**Preferred solution:** A parameter that allows enabling/disabling the text search behavior in `st.selectbox`.

### Additional context

This is one of several UX issues detected for st.selectbox. Others are:

- #4671 
- #4901 
- #5240 

---

Community voting on feature requests enables the Streamlit team to understand which features are most important to our users.

**If you'd like the Streamlit team to prioritize this feature request, please use the üëç (thumbs up emoji) reaction in response to the initial post.**

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-6160)

body: +1 here. Especially with long dropdowns, not having to scroll is very much desired by our users as well.

issue.title: Selectbox Scroll Location

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [X] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

Whenever we click into selectbox, it always starts from the beginning.
This makes it hard to track which option the user chose.
It aggravates the situation if the option list is long, making selecting of an option more difficult.

### Why?

It's hard to navigate a list of options when the length requires some scrolling. 

### How?

It would be nice if there is an argument that can "enable" an option where the selectbox is fixed at currently selected option instead of automatically starting from the beginning.

### Additional Context

_No response_

body: This is 2.5 years old, any progress?

issue.title: Preserve scroll position for `st.selectbox` and `st.multiselect`

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

When you click on a selectbox (or multiselect), scroll in the dropdown, then close it and click on the selectbox again, the dropdown opens at the top position. This can be annoying if the dropdown is large. With this PR, the dropdown will open at the same position where it was previously closed. Also, when the dropdown opens for the first time, it opens at the position of the selected default value.

**Before:**

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7b361fb1-0e0d-47db-b627-5391455a2228


**After:**

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/69ca577a-d78e-43fb-8a26-11ec56003638


## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Closes #4901

## Testing Plan

- Added a JS unit test on the `Selectbox` component that simulates scrolling, closes the dropdown, and checks that it opens at the same position. 
- Did not add an e2e test because it would basically do the same thing and that feels a bit overkill. But I can add e2e test for `st.selectbox` and `st.multiselect` if we want to have them. 

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

body: Hey, I'm working on a PR for this, see the link above. Will probably merge this soon and we should get this into the 1.42 release in early February!
Reopen since we had to revert the PR some time ago.

issue.title: Jump to previous selected element in selectbox

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [X] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

When the selectbox has a long option, it would be nice to jump to the selected element automatically.

### Why?

_No response_

### How?

Here's an example of 20 elements selectbox:

```
import streamlit as st

long_option = tuple(range(20))

option = st.selectbox(
    'How would you like to be contacted?',
    long_option)

st.write('You selected:', option)
```

When I select `14` and click the box again, it shows from 0:
![image](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/assets/30388627/babccf7f-33b2-4a85-a431-97ffdc0b4734)

It would be nice to show from 14:

![image](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/assets/30388627/62adfa48-adf1-4ea5-9415-0b18f025703f)


### Additional Context

_No response_
